message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper is about improving semantic segmentation using deep structured models and contextual information. The main focus is on training deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and combining them with Conditional Random Fields (CRFs) to capture patch-patch context between image regions. This work is highly relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) as it involves training deep neural networks and structured models. Additionally, the use of CRFs and the exploration of contextual information are also relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the evaluation of the proposed method on various datasets involves image and video processing (cs.MM).
